source.name: The NOMADS Ensemble Probability Tool
source.description: The NOMADS Ensemble Probability Tool is a tool that is designed to allow users to interrogate the high volume NCEP Global Ensemble (GENS) weather forecast model data (http://www.nco.ncep.noaa.gov/pmb/products/gens/) without downloading the data itself. The tool allows the user to describe a set of conditions and determine the probability that that set of conditions will occur at a given location.  By using this tool, users actually obtain 6hrly Probability Distribution Functions (PDF) output by using multiple OPeNDAP calls to each of the 21-member NCEP Global Ensemble System (GENS) forecasts and provides percentages of probability that a specific weather event may occur out to a forecast period to 16 days.  The data is passed via OpenDAP back to the application, where it is read using the Java NetCDF library, and then the probabilities are calculated.Prototype sms messaging (cell phone) alerts have already been developed at the request of the World Bank.
